Chapter XXIV. - Hygiene.

           Hygiene of the Home and Premises. 

     612. Dwellings, if possible, should be built upon high and dry ground. If a house be built where water settles around it, remaining for a time and then drying away, a poisonous miasma arises, and fever and ague, sore throat, lung diseases, and fevers will be the result.--H. to L., Chap. 4, p. 64.
